definition: to revisit old haunts (idiom); down memory lane
-ly/structural particle: used before a verb or adjective, linking it to preceding modifying adverbial adjunct

sentences.english: Remember repeat business is why you are in business.
sentences.chinese: 记得你是旧地重游，所以生意。

sentences.english: Go, let the old ground with me once.
sentences.chinese: 走吧，陪我旧地重游一次吧。

sentences.english: One day at a certain time, to return.
Here we are again, Its like a dream, but this is real to me (yeah)
sentences.chinese: 现在咱们旧地重游，如梦一场，但这都是真的。

definition: to revisit old haunts (idiom); down memory lane
to revive old dreams (idiom); to relive past experiences
like a thing of the previous generation/as if it were a lifetime ago
see 恍如隔世[huang3 ru2 ge2 shi4]
things have remained the same, but people have changed
scene which recalls past memories (idiom)/evocative of the past/reminiscent/to arouse deep feelings
The issue is in the past, and the situation has changed (idiom)./It is water under the bridge.
place one has previously visited/old haunts
to meet again after a long period of separation
to see each other/to meet in person
